SWOT.definition: SWOT Analysis is a structured technique used in business analysis to support strategic planning & market positioning.
SWOT.exampleUseCase: A project where a team uses SWOT Analysis to address a challenge in strategic strategy.
SWOT.why: SWOT Analysis is used to support clear decision-making, prioritize actions, or analyze business situations to enable value-driven outcomes.
SWOT.when: This technique is typically applied during the strategic planning & market positioning phase, especially when prerequisites such as stakeholder alignment, data availability, or project initiation are present.
how: Define the objective for using SWOT Analysis.
Gather necessary data or involve relevant stakeholders.
Apply the structure or framework specific to SWOT Analysis.
Review results and validate with stakeholders.
